field_reports.description:
Power outage: On Monday, around 12:30 PM, a widespread blackout occurred across mainland Spain for unknown reasons.

Impact: The blackout caused power cuts, road blockages, and transportation issues in much of the country, also affecting Portugal.

Gradual recovery: Red Eléctrica reported that full system recovery could take between six and ten hours. By 1:30 PM, they began restoring power in the northern and southern parts of the peninsula.

Areas with restored power: By 6:00 PM, power had been restored in parts of Catalonia, Aragon, the Basque Country, Galicia, Asturias, Navarre, Castile and León, Extremadura, Andalusia, and La Rioja. Other areas like Burgos and some parts of the Valencian Community and the Community of Madrid also regained power.

Areas still affected: Five hours after the outage, most of the central peninsula and some areas of the Levant were still without power.

results.name: ESP: Other - 04-2025 - Massive Power Outage
results.summary:

Areas with restored power: By 6:00 PM, power had been restored in parts of Catalonia, Aragon, the Basque Country, Galicia, Asturias, Navarre, Castile and León, Extremadura, Andalusia, and La Rioja. Other areas like Burgos and some parts of the Valencian Community and the Community of Madrid also regained power.

field_reports.description:
The situation in Spain after the passage of the DANA (high level atmospheric depression - cold drop, acronym in Spanish) is very severe. So far, 229 deaths have been confirmed, most of them in the province of Valencia. (Valencian Community (221), Castilla-La Mancha (7) y Andalusia (1)).

In addition, several people are missing and 78 localities are affected by severe flooding (75 in Valencia, 2 in Castilla-La Mancha and 1 in Andalusia). In the province of Valencia, Around 845,371 people live in the affected municipalities, approximately 32% of the population of this province.

Torrential rains have caused rivers to overflow, traffic cuts and rail service, building collapses and evacuations. In Valencia, some population areas such as Chiva and Pedralba have registered historic accumulations of up to 490 liters per square meter.

According to the preliminary analysis of the Copernicus program, the number of inhabitants directly affected by the floods is 75,000. 

The Government of the Generalitat Valenciana has declared “operational situation 2” procedure and national emergency teams have been deployed, including Army forces: 8,499 (total), of which 2,103 belong to the UME (including 22 psychologists and psychiatrists), to rescue trapped people and assist in recovery efforts, 9,728 State Security Forces and Corps and 309 forest firefighters.

results.name: ESP: Flood - 10-2024 - Inundaciones DANA
results.summary:
The situation in the Valencian Community after the passage of the DANA (high level atmospheric depression - cold drop, acronym in Spanish) is very serious. So far, more than 70 deaths have been confirmed, most of them in the province of Valencia. In addition, several people are missing and numerous localities are affected by severe flooding.
Torrential rains have caused rivers to overflow, traffic cuts and coverage, building collapses and evacuations. Power outage are affecting more than 140.000 people. In Valencia, some population areas such as Chiva and Pedralba have registered historic accumulations of up to 490 liters per square meter.
The Government of the Generalitat Valenciana has activated the “multiple victims” procedure and emergency teams have been deployed, including the Military Emergency Unit (UME), to rescue trapped people and assist in recovery efforts. The situation remains critical, and reconstruction work is expected to take months due to the extent of the damage.

field_reports.description:
El fuego, que sigue sin control, afecta ya a 8.400 hectáreas y ocupa un perímetro de 70 kilómetros. La orografía y la existencia de combustible seco por las altas temperaturas de los últimos días complicaron las tareas de extinción desde el primer momento. El incendio se ha propagado por los términos municipales de 11 de los 31 municipios de la isla (Arafo, Candelaria, El Rosario, La Orotava, Santa Úrsula, La Victoria, El Sauzal, La Matanza, Güímar, Tacoronte y Los Realejos). La zona más afectada hasta el sábado era el monte de La Esperanza, cerca del núcleo de población de El Rosario, y el parque natural de La Corona Forestal, en el noreste de la isla. El pronóstico de la Agencia Estatal de Meteorología (Aemet) para este sábado era de calor y calima en las islas Canarias, con temperaturas que podrían llegar hasta los 34 grados. El viento cambiante podría complicar las labores de extinción. La proximidad de las llamas ha obligado a la evacuación de 12.279 personas.

The fire, which remains uncontrolled, already affects 8,400 hectares and occupies a perimeter of 70 kilometers. The orography and the existence of dry fuel due to the high temperatures of the last days complicated the extinguishing tasks from the first moment. The fire has spread through the municipalities of 11 of the 31 municipalities of the island (Arafo, Candelaria, El Rosario, La Orotava, Santa Úrsula, La Victoria, El Sauzal, La Matanza, Güímar, Tacoronte and Los Realejos). The most affected area until Saturday was the mountain of La Esperanza, near the town of El Rosario, and the natural park of La Corona Forestal, in the northeast of the island. The forecast of the State Meteorological Agency (Aemet) for this Saturday was for heat and haze in the Canary Islands, with temperatures that could reach up to 34 degrees. The changing wind could complicate the extinguishing work. The proximity of the flames has forced the evacuation of 12,279 people.
field_reports.summary: ESP: Fire - 2023-08 - Incendio Forestal Arafo Candelaria

field_reports.description:
De acuerdo con las últimas actualizaciones proporcionadas por medios de comunicación, autoridades locales y por personal de la Cruz Roja desplegado en terreno, el Incencio Forestal de Pinofranqueado ha arrasado más de 10.000 hectáreas. 4 localidades de la provincia de Cáceres han sido evacuadas (Ovejuela, Cadalso, Descargamaría y Robledillo de Gata) y hay otras 3 con alta probabilidad de evacuación (Castillo, Las Erias y Aldehuela). De momento 694 personas han sido evacuadas.

Situación según Copérnicus con esta imagen a falso color: https://twitter.com/CopernicusEU/status/1659814056335687681/photo/1

According to the latest updates provided by the media, local authorities and Red Cross personnel deployed in the field, the Pinofranqueado wildfire has burned more than 10,000 hectares. 4 localities in the province of Cáceres have been evacuated (Ovejuela, Cadalso, Descargamaría and Robledillo de Gata) and there are 3 others with a high probability of evacuation (Castillo, Las Erias and Aldehuela). At the moment 694 people have been evacuated.

Situation according to Copernicus with this false color image: https://twitter.com/CopernicusEU/status/1659814056335687681/photo/1
field_reports.summary: ESP: Fire - 2023-05 - Incendio Forestal en Pinofranqueado

results.name: ESP: Fire - 2023-05 - Forest Fire in Pinofranqueado
results.summary:
According to the latest updates provided by the media, local authorities and Red Cross personnel deployed on the ground, the Pinofranqueado Forest Fire has razed more than 10,000 hectares. 4 towns in the province of Cáceres have been evacuated (Ovejuela, Cadalso, Descargamaría and Robledillo de Gata) and there are another 3 with a high probability of evacuation (Castillo, Las Erias and Aldehuela). So far, 694 people have been evacuated.

Situation according to Copernicus with this false-color image: https://twitter.com/CopernicusEU/status/1659814056335687681/photo/1

According to the latest updates provided by the media, local authorities and Red Cross personnel deployed in the field, the Pinofranqueado wildfire has burned more than 10,000 hectares. 4 localities in the province of Cáceres have been evacuated (Ovejuela, Cadalso, Descargamaría and Robledillo de Gata) and there are 3 others with a high probability of evacuation (Castillo, Las Erias and Aldehuela). At the moment 694 people have been evacuated.

Situation according to Copernicus with this false color image: https://twitter.com/CopernicusEU/status/1659814056335687681/photo/1

field_reports.description:
Although some of the forest fires are subsiding, new ones have broken out in recent days, keeping the population on tenterhooks, and have already devastated around 200,000 hectares of forest and woodland in the first few months of the year throughout Spain. 

The high temperatures that continue to be recorded mean that the situation continues to be of extreme risk. The Red Cross continues to mobilise at different points to assist people who have been evacuated and to offer logistical support to the state forces and corps working to extinguish the flames.
field_reports.summary: ESP: Fire - 2022-07 - Wildfires: several regions affected

results.name: ESP: Fire - 2022-07 - Wildfires: several regions affected

field_reports.description: Since September 11, the first seismic movements intensified and concentrated on the island of La Palma, in the Canary archipelago. Last Sunday, September 19, the Cumbre Vieja volcanic complex entered an eruptive phase, emitting gases and incandescent material, affecting the population. The very nature of the volcanic risk is of great uncertainty in its evolution. This situation could be prolonged in time and extend the affected area of the island. At this moment there is no evidence of personal damages, but the losses in public infrastructures and private houses are considerable, affecting the economic sectors of the island, such as the agricultural and livestock industry. So far 320 houses have been destroyed, 28 possibly damaged and more than 6,000 people have been evacuated from different affected localities or those in the path of the lava flows.

Thousands of migrants, coming from Morocco, arrived in the Spanish city of Ceuta in North Africa in the last 48 hours by swimming (mainly) or on foot. According to the Ministry of Interior the number of arrivals is over 8.000; national media however, referring official sources, estimate around 9.000 the number of people arrived in the country, most of them Moroccan nationals. Among the arrivals there are at least 1.500 minors (some of them unaccompanied) and entire families. The number of arrivals in such a short period of time is unprecedent in Spain. 
Spanish Authorities have sent to Ceuta additional army Units to protect the border and, according to the Minister of interior, Fernando Grande-Marlaska, around 4.000 adult migrants have been already deported to Morocco.
Spanish Red Cross has assisted 5.500 people with different services such as first aid, emergency health assistance, distribution of food, water and clothes, psychosocial support and shelter. So far, the National Society has mobilized more than 3.360 Hygiene kits, more than 3.000 blankets, 300 beds and 235 Rest kits (prepared for covering the hygiene and rest needs of 5 people each).
40 people (volunteers and staff) are currently involved in the response operation. From mainland, 22 people of SpRC emergency rapid response teams will be additionally deployed  to Ceuta tomorrow to strengthen the Red Cross response.
